answers.text:
Durham County, NC has a policy that asks nonprofits who are applying for funds to "focus on one or more of Durham County's Results Based Accountability (RBA) outcome areas." Those outcomes are:

Durham citizens are safe
Durham enjoys a prosperous economy
Durham citizens enjoy a healthy environment
Durham's citizens enjoy a community that is vibrant, rich in aesthetic beauty and embraces and promotes its cultural heritage
Children are ready for and succeeding in school
Every citizen in Durham has access to adequate, safe and affordable housing.
Durham citizens are healthy
Durham citizens enjoy sustainable, thriving neighborhoods with efficient and well maintained
infrastructure
Senior adults in Durham have optimum choices for the highest quality of life.

Applicants submit an application and then their applications are considered as part of the normal budgeting process.  For more information, you can visit their website at http://www.durhamcountync.gov/departments/bdmg/Non-Profit_Funding/NAFP.html
Douglas County, CO is hosting a Funding Forum in November.  Where agencies can come and learn about the different funding sources available to them, and learn which source is the most appropriate source of funding for their agency.  For more information visit http://www.douglas.co.us/CDBG/fundingforum/
I hope this information helps.

author: Mary Pendleton-Brown
text:
Due to the curent economic conditions I'm sure many of us are searching for funding sources for many programs.  We are welcoming any suggestions/creative solutions or competitive funding processes used to provide funding for not for profit programs and in-kind services.
Thank You,
title: Alternative Funding Solutions for Non-Profit Agencies
